definition: to overturn/to collapse/to lean/to tend/to incline/to pour out
leftist opportunism (blamed for failures of Chinese communists from 1927)/left adventurism/cf Mao's purges following 1935 Zunyi conference 遵義會議|遵义会议[Zun1 yi4 hui4 yi4]
pinyin: zuo3 qing1 ji1 hui4 zhu3 yi4

sentences.english: Again, Lu also showed his leftist mind in his criticism of the Guomingtang authorities.
sentences.chinese: 其次，魯迅的左傾也體現在對國民黨當局的批判中。

sentences.english: From his political piont of view, he has been pink for years.
sentences.chinese: 多年來，他的政治看法都比較左傾。

sentences.english: Apparently, the White House thinks that the Foreign Office is full of pinkos and traitors.
sentences.chinese: 白宮認爲外交部都是些左傾份子和賣國賊。

sentences.english: The Federal District is controlled by the left-leaning Party of the Democratic Revolution , or PRD .
sentences.chinese: 聯邦行政區是由民主革命左傾的黨派所控制的。

sentences.english: Pinko dogmatism is the most remarkable character of the controversy.
sentences.chinese: 中蘇大論戰最大的特點是左傾教條主義。

sentences.english: It is early days, but those who see a leftward tilt have a case.
sentences.chinese: 儘管爲時還早，但那些看出左傾苗頭的人也不無理由。

sentences.english: Research has found that the more girls a man has, the more likely he is to be Left-wing.
sentences.chinese: 研究表明，一個父親有越多的女兒，他會更左傾。

definition: May Fourth Movement/Chinese national renewal movement that started with 4th May 1919 protest against the Treaty of Versailles
to share the booty/to divide ill-gotten gains
